item.title: Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by Alison Weir
item.description: "I prefer to be left alone with my books." -- Alison Weir

item.title: Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by Alison Weir
item.description: "If only they would all just leave me alone with my books and my letters, I would be content to let life, and the world pass me by" -- Alison Weir

item.title: Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by Alison Weir
item.description: "You must pray to God for forgiveness because I can give you none" -- Alison Weir

item.title: Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Freedom lies in being bold." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "His heart danced upon her movements like a cork upon a tide. He heard what her eyes said to him from beneath their cowl and knew that in some dim past, whether in life or revery, he had heard their tale before." -- James Joyce

item.title: Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by Judy Blume
item.description: "Let children read whatever they want and then talk about it with them. If parents and kids can talk together, we won't have as much censorship because we won't have as much fear." -- Judy Blume

item.title: Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by Judy Blume
item.description: "[I]t's not just the books under fire now that worry me. It is the books that will never be written. The books that will never be read. And all due to the fear of censorship. As always, young readers will be the real losers." -- Judy Blume

item.title: Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by Judy Blume
item.description: "The best books come from someplace deep inside.... Become emotionally involved. If you don't care about your characters, your readers won't either." -- Judy Blume

item.title: Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by Judy Blume
item.description: "Fear is often disguised as moral outrage." -- Judy Blume

item.title: Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Isn't it nice to think that tomorrow is a new day with no mistakes in it yet?" -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by Bill Cosby
item.description: "A word to the wise ain't necessary, it's the stupid ones who need advice." -- Bill Cosby

item.title: Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Don’t put your wand there, boy! ... Better wizards than you have lost buttocks, you know!" -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "But Dumbledore says he doesn't care what they do as long as they don't take him off the Chocolate Frog cards." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by J.K. Rowling
Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by Claudia Gray
item.description: "Self-knowledge is better than self-control any day," Raquel said firmly. "And I know myself well enough to know how I act around cookies." -- Claudia Gray

item.title: Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by Laurell K. Hamilton
item.description: "Can the sarcasm,' he said. 'Please, I always use fresh sarcasm, never canned." -- Laurell K. Hamilton

item.title: Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by Rebecca Donovan
item.description: "In the balance of love and loss, it was love that made me struggle to… Breathe." -- Rebecca Donovan

item.title: Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by Rebecca Donovan
item.description: "I breathed for you... I begged for you to breathe with every breath I gave to you. I kept pleading for you to breathe over and over again. And then… then you did. ~ Evan" -- Rebecca Donovan

item.title: Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by Rebecca Donovan
item.description: "I close my eyes to the truth. I refuse to see what's happening, convinced that I can handle whatever it is believing that I'm strong enough and will recognize when I'm not. - Emma" -- Rebecca Donovan

item.title: Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by Lauren Oliver
item.description: "You can't be happy unless you're unhappy sometimes"." -- Lauren Oliver

item.title: Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Sometimes, you read a book and it fills you with this weird evangelical zeal, and you become convinced that the shattered world will never be put back together unless and until all living humans read the book." -- John Green

item.title: Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by Jandy Nelson
item.description: "My sister will die over and over again for the rest of my life. Grief is forever. It doesn't go away; it becomes a part of you, step for step, breath for breath. I will never stop grieving Bailey because I will never stop loving her. That's just how it is. Grief and love are conjoined, you don't get one without the other. All I can do is love her, and love the world, emulate her by living with daring and spirit and joy." -- Jandy Nelson

item.title: Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by Stephanie Perkins
item.description: "Is it possible for home to be a person and not a place?" -- Stephanie Perkins

item.title: Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by Stephanie Perkins
item.description: "French name, English accent, American school. Anna confused." -- Stephanie Perkins

item.title: Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by Stephanie Perkins
item.description: "I mean, really. Who sends their kid to boarding school? It's so Hogwarts. Only mine doesn't have cute boy wizards or magic candy or flying lessons." -- Stephanie Perkins

item.title: Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by Stephanie Perkins
item.description: "Girl scouts didn't teach me what to do with emotionally unstable drunk boys." -- Stephanie Perkins

item.title: Nicole (Reading Books With Coffee) add a quote by Stephanie Perkins
